intro: Archibaccharis veracruzana, commonly known as the Veracruz hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils.
